router isnt routing the packets back to your box
you could prove this to yourself if you want, do this:
sudo tcpdump -i eth0 src port 80
this will have tcpdump show you packets coming to port 80,  maybe you want dst port 80 actually,
then you can see if anything from the outside gets in
i'm 99% sure that you have a problem with packets getting from internet -> through your router -> to your box  on port 80

your router probably allows you to establish outgoing connections, and establishes sessions so packets can get back in, but it doesnt forward packets hitting your outside IP address to port 80 back to your internal computer's ip
